H0.text: Hydrogen bonding is formed in polar amino acid side chains.

H1.text: Calcium bonding is the type of bonding formed in polar amino acid side chains.

H2.text: Carbon bonding is the type of bonding formed in polar amino acid side chains.

H3.text: Helium bonding is the type of bonding formed in polar amino acid side chains.

A4.text: Hydrogen bonds also play a part in forming the tertiary structure of protein through interaction of R-groups.

A5.text: This type of bifurcated H-bond provides an intrahelical H-bonding partner for polar side-chains, such as serine, threonine, and cysteine within the hydrophobic membrane environments.
